articles.headline: Some Retailers Say More About Their Clothing’s Origins
articles.snippet: With fair-trade coffee and organic fruit now prolific, consumers concerned with working conditions and environmental issues are demanding more disclosure about what they wear.
articles.abstract: With fair-trade coffee and organic fruit now prolific, consumers concerned with working conditions and environmental issues are demanding more disclosure about what they wear.
articles.lead_paragraph: The revolution that has swept the food industry is expanding to retail: origins matter.

articles.headline: Enron’s Skilling Strikes Deal for Shorter Sentence
articles.snippet: Jeffrey K. Skilling, the former chief executive of Enron, has reached a deal with the Justice Department to shorten his prison term by as much as a decade, according to a court filing.
articles.abstract: Jeffrey K. Skilling, the former chief executive of Enron, has reached a deal with the Justice Department to shorten his prison term by as much as a decade, according to a court filing.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Diplomat Says Questions Over Benghazi Led to Demotion
articles.snippet: An official gave a riveting account of the terrorist attack in Libya last Sept. 11 and described its aftermath at a charged Congressional hearing that reflected weighty political stakes.
articles.abstract: An official gave a riveting account of the terrorist attack in Libya last Sept. 11 and described its aftermath at a charged Congressional hearing that reflected weighty political stakes.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A veteran diplomat gave a riveting minute-by-minute account on Wednesday of the lethal terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya, last Sept. 11 and described its contentious aftermath at a charged Congressional hearing that reflected the weighty political stakes perceived by both parties.
articles.byline: By Scott Shane, Jeremy W. Peters and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Errors Afflict More Checks Issued to Aid Homeowners
articles.snippet: Almost 100,000 homeowners got checks for less than they were owed under the settlement with the nation’s biggest banks.
articles.abstract: Almost 100,000 homeowners got checks for less than they were owed under the settlement with the nation’s biggest banks.
articles.byline: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: Google’s Aggregator Gives Way to an Heir
articles.snippet: Google Reader is scheduled to end July 1. And Feedly.com is just the newsreader to replace it.
articles.abstract: Google Reader is scheduled to end July 1. And Feedly.com is just the newsreader to replace it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Well, if we didn’t get it before, we get it now: Google giveth, and Google taketh away.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Impresario Plays Host in Las Vegas
articles.snippet: In an industry known for reclusive traders and math geeks, Wall Street’s Anthony Scaramucci is a P.T. Barnum in a Ferragamo tie.
articles.abstract: In an industry known for reclusive traders and math geeks, Wall Street’s Anthony Scaramucci is a P.T. Barnum in a Ferragamo tie.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Just outside the grand ballroom at the Bellagio hotel early Wednesday morning, Anthony Scaramucci, the backslapping host of the country’s largest hedge fund conference, spotted Gregory J. Fleming, president of Morgan Stanley Investment Management and one of Mr. Scaramucci’s most important business relationships.

articles.headline: Silicon Valley Group’s Political Effort Causes Uproar
articles.snippet: The advocacy group Fwd.Us, created by Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg and others, has shocked some liberals with its tactics in a campaign to support immigration reform.
articles.abstract: The advocacy group Fwd.Us, created by Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg and others, has shocked some liberals with its tactics in a campaign to support immigration reform.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Move fast and break things” has been the motto at Mark Zuckerberg’s Facebook, embodying the Silicon Valley ethos of unapologetically finding new ways to solve old problems. His latest foray into politics in Washington, however, might be characterized as “Move fast, play hardball and be prepared for blowback.”
articles.byline: By Somini Sengupta and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Boston Bomb Inquiry Looks Closely at Russia Trip
articles.snippet: Officials are investigating reports that Tamerlan Tsarnaev, a suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings, may have tried to contact Islamist extremists.
articles.abstract: Officials are investigating reports that Tamerlan Tsarnaev, a suspect in the Boston Marathon bombings, may have tried to contact Islamist extremists.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAKHACHKALA, Russia — During a six-month visit to his Russian homeland last year, the parents of  the Boston bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev said, he spent his time reading novels and reconnecting with family, not venturing into the shadowy world of the region’s militants.

articles.headline: A Lost Generation: Young Syrian Refugees Struggle to Survive
articles.snippet: More than half the 500,000 Syrian refugees in Jordan are under 18. “They can’t see beyond, frankly, the next day,” an aid worker said.
articles.abstract: More than half the 500,000 Syrian refugees in Jordan are under 18. “They can’t see beyond, frankly, the next day,” an aid worker said.
articles.lead_paragraph: SABHA, Jordan — The parents were petrified the oldest of their seven children would be drafted into the Syrian Army. For their teenage girl, they feared rape and kidnapping. And the next oldest, verging on adolescence, had begun rabble-rousing at school and in the street against the government.

articles.headline: Delta Sees New Terminal as Symbol of an Air Travel Makeover
articles.snippet: As financial health improves, the airlines are trying to lure passengers with better amenities and service instead of the lowest fares.
articles.abstract: As financial health improves, the airlines are trying to lure passengers with better amenities and service instead of the lowest fares.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Delta Air Lines executives tell it, the carrier’s bright and spacious new terminal at Kennedy Airport in New York reflects the industry’s new priorities.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Manager and S.E.C. Reach Deal
articles.snippet: Under the proposed deal, the hedge fund manager Philip A. Falcone has agreed to at least a two-year ban from raising new capital, and he and his fund will pay a fine of $18 million.
articles.abstract: Under the proposed deal, the hedge fund manager Philip A. Falcone has agreed to at least a two-year ban from raising new capital, and he and his fund will pay a fine of $18 million.
